topicSummary: Urethritis (inflammation of the urethra) is usually (but not always) caused by a sexually transmitted infection (STI).

topicHtmlObjects.htmlHeader: Urethritis - male: Summary

latestChanges.title: Minor update
latestChanges.body: Treatment options updated to be brought in line with updated BASHH guideline, Management of non-gonococcal urethritis.

latestChanges.title: Minor update
latestChanges.body: Adverse effects updated within prescribing information - metronidazole.

latestChanges.title: Minor update
latestChanges.body: Prescribing information updated with information regarding azithromycin interacting with colchicine.

latestChanges.title: Minor update
latestChanges.body: Drug reaction with eosinophilia and systemic symptoms (DRESS) has been added as a possible adverse effect of azithromycin ABPI, 2016.

latestChanges.title: Minor update
latestChanges.body: Minor typographical errors have been corrected.

latestChanges.title: Reviewed and re-written
latestChanges.body: A literature search was conducted in February 2015 to identify evidence-based guidelines, UK policy, systematic reviews, and key randomized controlled trials published since the last revision of this topic. There are no major changes to the recommendations in this topic. A prescribing information section has been added.
